did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, Spanish, French, Hebrew, and Hindi

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Jobs with Justice (JWJ) is a non-profit workers' advocacy organization based in Washington, D.C. Marking its beginning with a convening in Miami in 1987, JWJ started with members pledging to support others' fights for economic justice, as well as their own. Since that time, Jobs with Justice has grown to forty-five local affiliations in twenty-four states across the United States, and members now pledge to "stand up for our rights as working people to a decent standard of living; support the rights of all workers to organize and bargain collectively; fight for secure family-wage jobs in the face of corporate attacks on working people and our communities; organize the unorganized to take aggressive action to secure a better economic future for all of us; and mobilize those already organized to join the fight for jobs with justice" (http://www.jwj.org/about-us/our- history, accessed 2/7/14).

Jobs with Justice organizes across community lines, working with community, student, faith, and organized labor groups. Significant JWJ campaigns include the Justice for Janitors (1985), Justice at Verizon (1989), Justice at Smithfield (2008).

Communications Workers of America (CWA) President Larry Cohen founded Jobs with Justice in 1987. Since 2007, Sarita Gupta has served as Jobs with Justice's Executive Director. In 2012, American Rights at Work and Jobs with Justice merged.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Jobs With Justice Records #6369. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
